name: Prince of Persia®
description: The critically acclaimed Prince of Persia® franchise returns for the first time on next-generation platforms with an all-new epic journey. Built by the same award-winning Ubisoft Montreal studio that created Assassin's Creed™, Prince of Persia has been in development for over three years to deliver a whole new action-adventure gaming...
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows® XP/Windows Vista® (only)                     Processor: Dual core processor 2.6 GHz Intel® Pentium® D or AMD Athlon™ 64 X2 3800+ (Intel Core® 2 Duo 2.2 GHz or AMD Athlon 64 X2 4400+ or better recommended)                      Memory: 1 GB Windows XP/2 GB Windows Vista                     Graphics: 256 MB DirectX® 10.0–compliant video card or DirectX 9.0–compliant card with Shader Model 3.0 or higher (see supported list)*                      DirectX Version: DirectX 9.0 or 10.0 libraries                     Hard Drive: 9 GB                     Sound Card: DirectX 9.0 or 10.0–compliant sound card (5.1 sound card recommended)                     Input: Windows-compliant keyboard, mouse, optional controller (Xbox 360® Controller for Windows recommended)                     *Supported Video Cards at Time of Release:                     ATI® RADEON® X1600*/1650*-1950/HD 2000–4000 series                     NVIDIA GeForce® 6800*/7/8/9/GTX 260–280 series                     *PCI Express only supported                     Laptop versions of these cards may work but are NOT supported. These chipsets are the only ones that will run this game. For the most up-to-date minimum requirement listings, please visit the FAQ for this game on our support website at: <a href="https://steamcommunity.com/linkfilter/?url=http://support.ubi.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener"  >http://support.ubi.com.                     NVIDIA® nForce™ or other motherboards/soundcards containing the Dolby® Digital Interactive Content Encoder required for Dolby Digital audio.

reviews.review_text: Having already beaten this game in 2008, I remember loving everything about it, the graphics, the voice acting, the gameplay... everything was perfect. So the idea was to instal and play a relaxing game while I wait for Arkham Knight to get released.  Well, the 2008 me was kinda wrong... the combat in this game is just awful and cringe inducing, I have no idea what they were thinking when they made it so that you're blocking 70% of the time, with maybe 15% of free fighting, and 15% quick time events/button mashing. Maybe they were trying to make it harder artificially when they realized the game was too short and fun and easy, I don't know... but I wish the game had 0 combat and more environmental puzzles to fill in the blanks. Luckily though, there are not a ton of fights in the game, so they don't completely destroy the mood.  The controls could be a bit tighter, but they aren't horrible, they work... I mean it's a Ubisoft parkour game, you can't expect anything more out of it really.  The story is next to non-existent and that's OK. You're looking for a donkey, but instead you find a princess, now help her save the world... c'mon man, do it! She may not be a donkey, but she's hawt.  The game came out in 2008, and it looks absolutely amazing even by today's standards, with maybe some stiff animations and facial expressions that wouldn't be present if it were released today.  All in all, if you love and miss Playstation 2 era platformers, this game just might tickle your nut$@k. - 7.5/10

Cazualisation to the Maximum and beyond!   The First hour is really enjoyable, the characters are likeable, the atmosphere is great. But after a while you'll just end up wondering 'why the hell am I still playing this?'.  You really quickly end up doing the very same things over and over and over AND OVER, to the point where it all feels like one big chore.  The 'jumping arround' is fun but if you take a good look at it, it's rather limited. You end up running through the same patterns during the whole damn game. You fight each of the few bosses several times with litterally no differances in your approach (fights are just QTEs btw). The puzzles do nothing but slow down the pace for a short bit but won't require you to think much. The game allows you to interact with magical plates at some point, which allows you to get to new areas, but they don't bring any kind of diversity to the gameplay and are pretty flappin' anoying (especially the yellow ones)  The game is litterally just a succsession of QTEs, with a complete absence of challenge. The fact that you can't die, even during combats, thanks you your qt magical gf, removes any kind of threatning situation. All that's keeping you away from the end of the game is just the fact that you have to collect shiny stuffs that are all arround the place. It's entertaining at first but it's really all there is to do, and it's not satisfying.  This game stands as a reminder of why QTEs are dumb ♥♥♥♥ and why having a 'fail state' is vital to any game of this kind. Too bad.

I love the POP series, but this game is a repetitive chore. There is nothing of interest in this game. You climb the same exact areas, the same exact level designs, collecting shiny orbs, with an occasional 'boss' battle. It is an insultingly lazy game. Ubisoft did not care one bit about the game itself, the orb collecting and area opening aspect of the game, which is the biggest part by far, is the most boring thing ever in a game. The prince's and Elika's relationship is by far the best aspect of the game, but honestly the game is not worth playing for that reason alone. The only positve thing I can say about the game is the cellshaded graphics, and the general art direction. Other than that, just pass this one, it's not worth the money. 4/10
This is the only PoP game that I like and is one of my favorite games ! It's a shame I played it a few years after the realise !

Very good game but only for one gameplay. If you try to play this game again in the future, you will notice that it is boring and monotone. But at the first time you will be enchanted by the beautiful graphics and locations.

Prince of Persia (2008) is a super easy game with a cool art style and a Zelda-like combat system. It is a very peaceful and relaxing game. Unfortunately, the characters are stupid, the story is soooo dumb, and you have to grind through a bunch of levels that are the same exact difficulty. Plus, there is A LOT of backtracking in this game. Oh and did I mention that you can't even die or lose? This game is definitely for SUPER casual gamers because it offers NO challenge whatsoever.

I'm about to spoil the ♥♥♥♥ out of this.  You manage to free the bad guy, you literally fight 5 annoying enemies that can't die like hundred times, to go back and imprison the bad guy again to free him again and your 4 hour game go to waste.  Love the ending though, very deep.  ♥♥♥♥♥♥ combat system.  The good: beautiful graphics, amazing escenarios, open world (which due to it's repetitive nature may not be that good), great music.  I'll recommend it to you on sale only and take it like what it really is, a flash platformer game, get it for 2 to 3 USD no more.  [b/]Elika is hot and powerful and the prince have great punch lines, the beauty and the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ muscled clown great couple.[/b]
One of the best games i have played. Awesome art work, great gameplay, the only thing is that I´m not sure what to think about the ending

I was really surprised by this title. It's a fairly expansive (read: long) and they really did a good job on translating the old 2D PoP mechanics into 3D and then built levels that took advantage of them. I had a blast playing this game, aside from a few spots in a few levels and limited combat sequences, it was fun without being frustrating. The game progress is fairly linear without being obvious about it, since the game basically uses a huge interconnected world that you're free to explore whenever you want, though progress forward on branches can be blocked at various points by tools and abilities that you haven't uncovered yet. Once you uncover the tool or ability you can return and progress further, and sometimes there's multiple branches it unlocks so you don't always have to continue down a single branch.  It's a shame Ubisoft basically went nowhere with PoP after this title, instead rehashed the mechanics and engine of the earlier 3D titles with their subsequent game, including the tedious fixation on combat.  Note that I played through this title on my own a couple years ago in a non-Steam form, hence my short amount of Steam gameplay that doesn't cover a full playthrough.
I've played this game long time ago and it was great, the design and everything is amazing.

i really like the prince of persia franchise, and this is not a REALLY bad game, but hey:  -It will make everything REALLY repetitive and annoying at some points! (mostly half troughout the game)  -You like fights? fight the same way again, and again, and again...  -Spend much more time than you would like to searching orbs  -They could had made a deeper story, for example, explain more about the place and anemies histories, we only got Elika saying 'meh, they were like this.....then did that...sold their souls now they're anemies!' ( i think i be ♥♥♥♥♥ing too much about this, but i thought that the sotry could be much more richier and deeper).   It is not a must-have by any means, but you can buy it, if you like prince of persia, but don't expect much of it.

Such a dissapointment... prince of persia is by far my favorite game in the world and to think they made this game into a childs play smh :(. they went from killing and assasination to a game where its basically impossible to die, the monsters are reputive and are just goos are globs, parkouring to another destination is at ease where theres always someone there to just pick you up and leave you at the same spot where you attempted to jump! i really tried to love this game and would jump right back on it even if i got sick if it but the cons overall the pros overall. im srry to all the fans who had to endure such a dissapointed installment of the game but at least the graphics where pleasing to look at, and the way they tried to so desperately change fighting mechanics into something more suitable for the pc users out there was fun at fisrt until it got to a point where there was nothing but 1 on 1 action... there wasnt hordes of monsters or guys charging at you there but a duel instead with measley somewhat barely of a monster. im begging the forgotten sands isnt as bad as this one.

Well the graphics are good the climbing is nice but the game is boring... The fights are awful and you can't die in this game.As much I tried to like this game because of previous Prince of Persia games I didn't like and I didn't enjoyed it I think that the game is well-suited to kids under the age of 12 years old.
boring
Best Prince of Persia game.
A Prince of Persia game in which you can never die. Yes, it's just as dull as a risk-less platformer sounds.
still waiti' for pop 6 :( this game is ending like he was starting :(
Mostly great platforming, alright combat

The Sands of Time Trilogy has the best game-story ever made. After the Trilogy this Prince of Persia has second best game-story in my opinion. Fighting against a God which he is immortal, omnipotent, omniscient, omnipresent. Awesome musics, very cool fighting scenes.   10/10
Well this game would be worth if it could run on windows 10, really wished to replay it.
Dr. Who... why don't you travel back in time to save me the $ on this PoS? :(

A game that I really wanted to enjoy but overall felt like it fell short of the mark. The storyline was mediocre with a meh ending. The combat and some of the abilities (especially the flying ones) were very frustrating at times. Even the voice acting was not that great. Really, you couldn't get someone besides Nolan North to do the Prince's voice? It's such a unique and highly used voice now that it kind of pulled me out of the game.  I think the most frustrating part of it all is this game really feels like it had a lot of potential. The artwork and graphics are quite pretty (except during the weird glitches). The music was quite lovely even though there wasn't much of it. It was a Ubisoft game without Uplay. Jumping around was even quite fun albeit a little repetative. I wish I could say more positive things about the game but even my compliments sound like complaints. I would only recommend this game if it was on sale and if you really really enjoy platform games.  6.5/10.0

This game is not compatible with the Steam Controller to the extent that it will cause the game not Launch... Period!  The game itself seems funny, and wonderfully designed. Easy controls, however; has an obnoxious tutorial that you'd except EA, except this one follows you throughout the gameplay for some reason.

Pretty game. Aside from that it balances on a really thin line between ok and awfull. I mean the game is REALLY PRETTY and I love the overrall designs, both the world and the chars. HOWEVER, despite how awesome some of the new platformer mechanics are, NO ONE should be forced to go through the same paths over and over and over AD ETERNUM!   So the game keeps a good job on entertaining but more often than it should, it makes you realize that you are wasting your time by forcing you to do some boring as hell task, aka collect orbs. Already expecting something like this to happen I collected as many orbs as I could without straying from my path throughtout the game, and it seems that wasn't enough. Sure I got my first power without a problem, but what about the second? For that one I had to collect orbs, since I barely had half of the required ammount! Screw this!   This sort of playtime extending technique is something rarely forgiven, and not always despised in two situations:   a) They are made interesting and hilarious (Saints Row 2 POOP AVENGER XD)  b) The game is for some reason compelling, on either Story or Mechanics.   POP fails in both and at the same time unjustly compromises it's strong point: World Design. Would you pay to see the tip of the Mount Everest once? Probably yes. What about a second time? Perhaps if it was good. And what about another 20 times? HECK NO.   POP combat mechanics are ridiculous.  POP exploration mechanics are ok, but the whole no risk I'll just grab you back up thing kills the mood.  POP story is overral bad or at least lacking the urge to know more.   POP is an ok game, but it doesn't live to the Sands of Time Trilogy. Now those were AMAZING!   P.S. Btw, the dlc is storywise important, and it's only available on the consoles -_-
Did you mean 'Prince of Parkour'?

You will not shake the feeling off that this game is only half finished. Yes, it starts off very good and you love but the closer to the end you get the more primitive and absurd the game gets.   + this game has an artofficial increase of game's length. For example the game will you give completely non contextual plaforming which will be Ctr+C + Ctr+V platforms one after another. I know it's the point of platforming but this one didn't take any effort after the first sections. It's like...the first sections of the game are done and the rest is ...well.. done very poorely to say the least. I did not finish it because the game started to just waste one's time after 1/2 of it was done. Not even dialogues matched the situations that were happening.    I loved the characters though. They WERE very well written until I finished 1/2 of the game. After that I was thing countless times 'why did you say that? That had no contextual input whatsover.'   Exagerated example:   -How do we get up there?  -I don't know -Maybe we should.. -Bananas!  -what?  -The temple ....I'm sorry.. -WHAT?!   I'm not even kidding. It's like HALF of the game was cut out and thrown in the dumpster because of some 'awesome' manager.   5/10 - because only half the game is done. Or at least it feels like it.   I said nothing about the bad controlls because every PoP had bad controlls and well.. it's the way it is. If the game is good, the controlls won't bother you. Here - they did.
fun game but a little bit a hard game
A complete chore to play.

It's not your typical Prince of Persia game, but that is what I liked most about it. The story is more relatable, the characters are easier to attach to, and the water-color-esque art style is the perfect counterpart to it all. I've beaten this game four times now, yes four times, though my steam account won't reflect that (beat it outside of steam, on PS3 twice, and once on 360), and have enjoyed every second of it. You can buy it dirt cheap now, and it's worth every penny. I'm not trying to peer pressure you guys into a purchase, but DO IT. Do it. Do it. Come on, what are you chicken? Just do it.

Beautifull looking 3d platformer with okay combat. Prince of Persia 2006 is a reboot of the Prince of Persia franchise and revolves around a new 'prince'. The free-running is more on rails this time, and is more about timed button pressing the steering. The combat is now one-on-one with a large list of combo's which you most of the time won't get to use, due to the enemy blocking. The environments are beautifully cell shaded and look amazing at high settings. The story is pretty good, with the chatter between the main characters being the highlight. Collecting orbs to unlock levels can be annoying, but gives a reason to check out the levels in both their corrupt and cleaned states. The 'epilogue' DLC available on consoles is missing on PC, but the non-epilogue ending is better anyway, seeing as no sequel to this game was ever released.
One of the most vibrant games i've played in a while. Very enjoyable atmosphere and art style. In my opinion best game in franchise after PoP: Sands of Time.

It's a positively beautiful game that is fun to play. Some places are easy, some are pretty hard, together it makes a balanced experience. I find the whole concept of cleaning the world from corruption very appealing, I wish it could be done outside of the game as well. The visuals are great, the voice acting is superb, dialogs cheer you up with humour, the female companion is pretty, overall I find it an enjoyable experience. I thought it's mostly for a younger audience, it looks so console-ish. But when you play, it's all fine, and fights are fun, especially since you can't exactly 'die'. Lots of cool movements and tricks you can pull with the enemies. Just as you're getting tired of jumping and performing acrophobic acrobatics, there comes a fight for a change. A few dialogs afterwards ease the tension. A few last boss fights are rather exhausting, as they are full of quick time events, and you must remember which symbol corresponds to which button to press. But when you master it, it can be fun, but maybe too enduring. Unfortunately, the game doesn't quite end, because of a DLC that was never released for PC, only for consoles. But if gaming for you is a recreational activity, I can recommend this one. It won't wear you down as much as it will entertain. It is pretty long, took me 35 hours to finish it. Now I wonder if I should buy PS3 just to play that DLC...

Do You remember when You started the Sands of Time for the first time? That glorious felling of being pulled into a great adventure beyond your imagination? Then treasure it and don't let your brain overwrite it by this game.   While bearing the name of the good old running, jumping, climbing trees with occasional monster fight game it is no like it. You are playing as a thief, badly written, pseudo-funny thief, who got lost in a sandstorm and runs in to a girl , magical girl, who is a princes of totally made up kingdom with absolutely overdone looking architecture which looks like paintings that have all been draw with one move making spirals and more spirals every time... and because you are a bad thief, you decide to help her. So You must save the kingdom from the darkness by finding the four bosses, defeating them over and over with no significant change of environment throughout the whole game.   Do You like collectables? When you have to collect thousands pieces of something just to gain reward, then guess what. You can't finish this game without collecting all the thousand pieces of something, because You need them to unlock a way to get to the bosses. But there is nothing else to do either because there is absolutely minimum of story. And only distraction while running through the plain wasteland of the game map are the conversation between prince and the magical girl, so poorly written that You'll stop paying attention to them after 5 seconds. In comparison with previous instalments of the Prince the running, jumping, climbing trees is much better in this one. It has been made faster and bit more vivid, but the fact that environment does not change throughout the whole game makes that totally pointless. The time powers are gone, replaced by spiderman wall running, and even when we knew that not every prince of Persia must control time it seems kind of silly that every time you fall the magical girl pulls you back up from the midair like nothing. Battle system is even more boring, allowing you fight only one enemy at the time with no acrobatic kill moves making it only more painfull.    Do Yourself a favour, don't buy it. Go play Sands of Time. And if You want to run, jump and climb trees like this thief-prince, The Forgotten Sands are still a better option than this. XD

I finally got a chance to play this gem, and I really liked it. The game is beautiful, and the platforming and combat mechanics are a lot of fun. There's a focus on climbing and jumping, which I like, but still enough combat to keep things interesting. The gameplay can get repetitive, but each area is worth exploring. Gathering light seeds slows things down a bit. I like hunting down as many as I can find, but once you have a certain amount, you can move on if you like. There's no need to gather them all.  Overall, the story is good and unfolds nicely. The ending is good too, but may leave you wanting more. In fact, there is more... an Epilogue DLC that didn't make it to PC (thanks Ubisoft). You can play it on console or watch it on YouTube. I wish I could say the Epilogue ending is better than PC, but it's not. In any case, this game is well worth your time.  TIP: If the loading screen is slow or stuck, try turning on V-Sync in the launcher settings.

Different from the original series, but makes up with unique scenery, so fitting atmosphere and music. Also fights are real fun going with a sidekick to lengthen your combos. One of the best game I have ever played.. Just think about it as a different prince...
10/10 Husbando    Rest is cool too

This is quite possibly the most underrated game of the previous generation. Most people shunned it because of how much it shyed away from the SoT Trilogy but this is a spectacular game in its own right. Starting with the story, this is one of the best written games of last generation, and its simple to play. While the combat system might be dumbed down for previous PoP titles, there is still a plethera of comboas to try and land with this games combat system. Toss in the spectacular character development and interaction between Elika and the Prince, and the beautifully rendered environments. This game is sure to please.
I don't care if its not some peoples favorit Prince of Persia, and yeah the Prince is a bit of an @ss. Its still one of my favorit games.

A very simple yet enjoyable story, delivers likable characters. Gameplay while also simple makes it easy to enjoy the beauty of the games visual.  Yes you can not die but this helps to cut away loading time whenever you fail (if you even do) long platforming sequences.  Yes the combat is only one on one (one of two) but the ammount of combos you can do it very well in depth and some of the later enemies require you to use paticular attacks before you can use other moves.  Sadly because of a lot of negitivity when this game came out the story ends and will never get a proper conclusion it deserves.
This game is actually really good. Like. Really good.

I should say this is one of my favorite games, the beautiful view makes it unbearable to let go of the game as for the game play and the method of fighting i guess it doesn't have the much to talk about and the dialogues are funny but sometimes it looks like the guy in the game is like a really dangerous and on the other hand stupid and all. there is another problem even though the view is outstanding but it is not possible to take pictures like other games. anyway i recommend it for the people who seek a game for relaxation and enjoyable view and lively scenes.
dont even remember playing this
Short and easy but beautiful graphics and great story
By far the most average video game I have ever played. Good story, decent platforming, bad combat, great art direction. Not really worth a playthrough.
Awesome game. First of the series I've played and I'm looking into playing the others. This one seems a bit more...modern as far as graphics are concerned.

Such an awesome game... the art style is fantastic and the music is second to none. I really enjoy the banter between the two characters and the acrobatic parcour-style platforming is a blast. A lot of people bash this game for being too easy but I look at it as more of an experience than anything. WELL worth the $10.
No words can describe how much I love this game. One of a kind

Strong art direction, some of the best use of cel-shading I've seen. Reminiscent of Okami. The gameplay however is so easy - it's impossible to die - that the whole game kinda feels like a glorified quicktime event. The story and the characters also fail to make a lasting impression, though the romance between the prince and the princess is at times quirky enough to be refreshing.

Wonderful Game! Very Adventurous and addicting! Loved the graphics and gameplay. Its a must play for any person ready to climb walls and do crazy stunts! The story is great! This is a aww dropping game! Totally loved it from begging to the end!!
The best of the prince of persia games in my humble opinion
Spank that ♥♥♥.
Collected 669 Light Seeds.  669/10 would collect that amount again.

Once I got it to load quickly (now i know what v-sync is for and never had to use) it is quite enjoyable. Really enjoy the music and puzzling out the environment. Dialog has made me laugh more then a few times

+ great platform action + rich, varied environments + interesting visual style, holds up well after many years + good replay value  - dialogue a tad cheesy at times, and there is lots of it - combat is repetitive and limited

Not your classic beat-em-up Prince of Persia game. However if you like more platform puzzle games for their story than their challenge (this game is easy) this game is fabulous. Highly recomended for relaxing/frustrating on decent levels.

Well, I do not write review for games.. my english is not on that level. But I would like to make an exception for thi one.  This is not a classic PoP game, if you are looking for that, you will be quite disappointed. But if you are looking for dynamic game, with beautiful music, interesting characters, if you just want to play something for fun, this may be good choice to start.
